document_title: Cystitis in women: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: viem-bang-quang-o-nu-gioi.json_8_What measures help prevent female cystitis?
subsection_content:
Health experts give some recommendations to help you effectively prevent cystitis in women:
Drink a lot of water; Urinate as soon as you feel the need. Avoid holding urine for too long; Use safe methods when having sex and urinate immediately after sex; Except for cleaning solutions specifically for the vaginal area, avoid using soap or scented products.; Limit the use of spermicides or IUDs. You should discuss with your doctor to get advice on effective and safe birth control methods.

Cystitis in women is a fairly common urinary tract infection. Although the disease is not complicated and relatively easy to treat, cystitis is easy to recur and has potentially dangerous complications.

In addition, doctors and medical experts always encourage you to have a general examination twice a year to be screened for hidden, asymptomatic diseases and treated promptly.
